g.text: Day 14: Configuration Management.
Configuration management is the way how DevOps engineers manage the configuration of servers or infrastrucre.
now let us understand what actually this means using a example.
So before DevOps organizations would have system administrator who were managing and configuring this servers.
On Premisis Server
total 100 servers
System Administrator
50 servers on Windows
25 on Linux
25 on CenOs
The day to day task of system anministrator was to
- update the server
- install packages or applications that developers require.
- configure load balancing etc
so to do such things in 100 servers was very hectic job so they use to write scripts before devops came into picture.
- But the problem is was thier are varity of servers here like, 50 of them are runnig windows, some of them are in linux etc.
so for windows we need to write powershell script, for linux shell script etc, so this was not efficent.
So to stop this problem a new tool was required and this tools were called as "Configuration Management Tools"
Following tools were discovered aiming to solve this Problem.
- Puppet
- Cheif
- Ansible
- Salt
Puppet Vs Ansible
Puppet
Ansible
- Puppet is Pull Mechanism Model.
- We have to configure as "Master
Slave".
- We have to learn Puppet language
to write the tasks.
- Ansible is Push Mechanism Model.
- Ansible is "Agentless" model.
we have a file called "inventory" in which we just put the
ip addresses of all the servers.
- Works with both Windows and Linux.
- Its simple to use and uses "yml" file to write the playbooks.
what does Push and Pull Model mean??
- Suppose we have given as task to install and update a package on 10 EC2 instances.
- now suppose if we were using "Ansible which is Push model", we will simple write ansible playbook
on one of the ansible server, and push that playbook to all other 10 EC2 instances.
- Now Suppose if we were using "Puppet which is Pull Model", we have to configure this 10 EC2 instances
in "Master Slave" architecture.
Master
Slave
Some Interview Quetions.
1" What language Ansible uses or is Built Using?
- Python.
2: Does ansible support for both Linux and Windows? what protocol it uses to connect with both??
- Yes, Ansible support for both Linux and Windows.
- For Linux it uses "ssh" protocol to connect.
- For Windows it use "Win Rm" protocol to connect.
3: Puppet vs Ansible or Why you choose to use Ansible only??
- Ansible is Agentless.
- Uses Yml language.
4: What is Push and Pull Mechanism??
5: can ansible access the machines of AWS/GCP/Azure etc??
- Ansible doesnt require any platform to run, it just need public ip of
the servers and they should be configured for Password less Authentication.
